original: Kullberg, Tröste Sadi Buonarotti, direktör, Göteborg, f. 4/1/89 i Karlshamn av v. hhövd. Tröste K. o. Pau-line Jamsson. G. 26 m. Gertrud Johansson. ■— Mog:ex. i Karlskrona 07, jur. kand. i Lund 11. V. förm. i Lunds stud:kårs soc. utsk. 08-09’ tf. lands-kont. 08-10, tf. e. länsnot., tf. läns-bokh., tf. länsnot. i Blek. län 12-14, tf. domihaiv. 14-16, not. i riksd. la^utsk. 16, isekr. i Sv. arbetsgiv :fören. 17, i pappersind. sv. arb :tidskomm. 18-19, dir :assist. i Sv. arbetsgiv :fÖTen. 20, förest. f. dess allm. grupps Gbgs’kont. sed. 30. Ordf. i Sv. granitind :förb. sed. 42. Passiv medl. i Gbgs friv. motorbåtsflottilj sed. 30. RVO, Patrst-GM.
translated: Kullberg, Tröste Sadi Buonarotti, director, Gothenburg, born 4/1/89 in Karlshamn to vice headmaster Tröste K. and Pauline Jamsson. Married on 26th of an unknown month to Gertrud Johansson. ■— Completed examinations in Karlskrona in 1907, law degree in Lund in 1911. Vice president of the social committee of Lund's student corps from 1908-1909, acting county controller from 1908-1910, acting county treasurer, acting county accountant in Blekinge County from 1912-1914, acting district court clerk from 1914-1916, notary in the Parliament's legislative committee in 1916, legal secretary in the Swedish Employers' Association in 1917, in the Swedish paper industry's joint wage commission from 1918-1919, director's assistant in the Swedish Employers' Association in 1920, head of its general group in Gothenburg since 1930. Chairman of the Swedish granite industry association since 1942. Passive member of the Gothenburg voluntary motorboat flotilla since 1930. Recipient of the Order of Vasa, Patriotic Medal of Merit.
